concepts.name: Zettelkasten
concepts.summary: A note-taking and knowledge management method based on interconnected atomic notes.
concepts.explanation: The Zettelkasten method, developed by German sociologist Niklas Luhmann, is a knowledge management system based on creating small, atomic notes that are interconnected through links. Each note captures a single idea and is linked to related notes, creating a network of knowledge that grows organically over time.

concepts.name: Second Brain
concepts.summary: A methodology for saving and systematically organizing your ideas and insights.
concepts.explanation: Building a Second Brain (BASB) is a methodology created by Tiago Forte for capturing, organizing, and sharing knowledge using digital tools. It emphasizes capturing information that resonates with you, organizing it for actionability, and regularly reviewing and using your notes to create new content.

concepts.name: Atomic Notes
concepts.summary: The principle of creating notes that capture a single, self-contained idea.
concepts.explanation: Atomic notes are self-contained units of knowledge that focus on a single concept or idea. By keeping notes atomic, they become more reusable, easier to link, and simpler to understand. This principle is fundamental to methods like Zettelkasten and helps avoid creating large, unwieldy documents.
